entry.title: In Response to Peter Todd | secureanonymoussurfing.com
entry.summary: In response to a statement made by Peter, the owner of the domain vistomail.com clarifies that the domain has not changed hands since it was registered. The recent update on who.is regarding the purchase of additional years was done to prevent the domain from expiring. The owner expresses frustration with Peter's constant arguments and smart comments on Twitter, urging him to stop arguing and work harder.The owner also mentions that their ability to submit posts in bitcoin-dev, bitcoin-core-dev, and lightning-dev has been stopped, indicating that new developers no longer want them around. They add satoshin at vistomail.com and contact at vistomail.com as lightning addresses to counter Craig Wright's attempts to sue individuals and claim to be the creator of Bitcoin. The owner claims to have many other ways to prove their identity as the real Satoshi but never felt the need to do so.Additionally, the owner compliments the Lightning team for their work and thanks them for making them feel welcomed. They provide their lightning address at contact at secureanonymoussurfing.com and express gratitude for the great things accomplished by the team. The email includes various attachments, including an HTML attachment, a public key attachment, and a signature attachment.
